# Support

## Getting Help

Thanks for using IssueFlow! Here are ways to get help:

### Documentation

- [README](https://github.com/VibeTensor/IssueFlow#readme) - Project overview and quick start
- [Contributing Guide](https://github.com/VibeTensor/IssueFlow/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) - How to contribute
- [Hacktoberfest Guide](https://github.com/VibeTensor/IssueFlow/blob/master/HACKTOBERFEST.md) - Hacktoberfest participation

### Community

- [GitHub Discussions](https://github.com/VibeTensor/IssueFlow/discussions) - Ask questions and share ideas
- [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/VibeTensor/IssueFlow/issues) - Report bugs and request features

### Bug Reports

If you've found a bug:
1. Check [existing issues](https://github.com/VibeTensor/IssueFlow/issues) to avoid duplicates
2. Use the [bug report template](https://github.com/VibeTensor/IssueFlow/issues/new?template=bug_report.md)
3. Include steps to reproduce, expected vs actual behavior, and environment details

### Feature Requests

To suggest a new feature:
1. Check [existing discussions](https://github.com/VibeTensor/IssueFlow/discussions/categories/ideas)
2. Use the [feature request template](https://github.com/VibeTensor/IssueFlow/issues/new?template=feature_request.md)

### Security Issues

For security vulnerabilities, please see our [Security Policy](https://github.com/VibeTensor/IssueFlow/security/policy).

## Response Times

| Type | Expected Response |
|------|-------------------|
| Security issues | 24-48 hours |
| Bug reports | 3-5 business days |
| Feature requests | 1-2 weeks |
| General questions | 3-7 days |

## Code of Conduct

Please note that this project follows a Code of Conduct. By participating, you are expected to uphold this code.

---

**IssueFlow** is maintained by [VibeTensor](https://github.com/VibeTensor).
